Key Match Events: Kyle Schwarber led off the first inning with a home run for Philadelphia (83-56)
Kody Clemens hit his fourth homer of the season to deep right field
Cristopher Sanchez allowed two runs over seven quality innings
Schwarber hit a 92.9 m.p.h. four-seam fastball for a two-run home run
Three consecutive doubles gave Toronto the lead in the bottom of the first
Kody Clemens re-took Philadelphia's lead in the second with a two-run home run
Post-Match Reflections: John Schneider talked about starter Bowden Francis' start against the Philadelphia Phillies
Harper left the game after the first inning with a left elbow contusion
The Blue Jays have Thursday off before heading to Atlanta for a weekend series against the Braves
Miscellaneous Highlights: Philadelphia completed the series mini-sweep over the Toronto Blue Jays
Ranger Suarez (11-6) will take the mound for the Phillies on Thursday
